definition: to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: At the last lap John held him,and then began to pick up on him.
sentences.chinese: 在最后一圈约翰追上了他，并开始超过他。

sentences.english: LeBron will catch him, but today it's still Bird.
sentences.chinese: 勒布朗会追上他的，但现在还是拉里伯德。

sentences.english: A word once spoken cannot be taken back, even with a team of four horses.
sentences.chinese: 一句话说出了口，就是套上四匹马拉的车也难追上。

sentences.english: They caught up with the old Jedi in a hidden hangar.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一个隐蔽的机库里追上了这名老绝地。

sentences.english: Get ahead and know that some of those things they'll catch back up.
sentences.chinese: 往前走，明白有些事情他们会重新追上来。

sentences.english: I picked up the money after she, return the money to her.
sentences.chinese: 我捡起钱后追上她，把钱还给她。

sentences.english: It is the dog drives the opossum up in an apricot tree.
sentences.chinese: 是狗将白鼻心追上了杏子树。

sentences.english: Shouhou after Wang Shaoqiang, also along with the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 瘦猴追上王少强，也要一起上山。

sentences.english: In an instant this crowd had overtaken and surrounded me.
sentences.chinese: 一下子，那群人追上了我，把我围了起来。

sentences.english: Go after them quickly. You may catch up with them.
sentences.chinese: 你们快快地去追赶，就必追上。

sentences.english: 5 but the Babylonian army pursued the king and overtook him in the plains of Jericho.
sentences.chinese: 迦勒底的军队追赶王，在耶利哥的平原追上他。

sentences.english: Overtake it or miss it for ever.
sentences.chinese: 追上它抓住它，否则就永远失去了它。

sentences.english: He ran so fast that I didn't catch up with him.
sentences.chinese: 他跑得那么快以至于我没追上。

sentences.english: I quickened my steps but the bad guy was gaining on me.
sentences.chinese: 我加快脚步，但是那个坏人却渐渐追上我。

sentences.english: Can you walk slowly and let me catch up with your shadow.
sentences.chinese: 能不能走慢点，让我追上你的影子。

definition: to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to shake off/to get rid of
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to throw off/to abandon/to cast off/to get rid of/to dump
to run away/to take to one's heels
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
